hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I support Manchester United g fuel shaker cup amazon The failure to tax capital gains at the point of death costs the federal government about $50 billion a year. Taxing those gains would both raise money in the future, and induce earlier and greater realizations of capital gains in the short term, likely adding well over $500 billion over a 10-year period. I believe it is plausible to raise $1 trillion over the next 10 years by going after such provisions that cause what adds to wealth and spending not to be regarded as income.
